metadata.title: CVE-2018-25032 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., whencompressing) if the input has many distant matches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu9
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu9
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu9
zlib1g - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu9
No subscription required

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1

criterions.comment: zlib package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu9').
mariadb-10.6 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.11-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
klibc package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
